An amazing continuation to one of the best games out there.

Pros: - Everything good about Half Life 2 (pretty much everything)
- The City 17 wreckage offers some great new levels to play through, and offers a lot of variety for the length of this DLC.
- Valve were able to balance moods well, from more lighthearted moments with Alyx to more tense (even horror to an extent) sections with darker lighting.
- Great variety of activities (puzzles, combat, escorting NPCs, story moments).
- Once again, it's Half-Life 2.

Cons: - It is somewhat short.
- Nothing really happens in the story (but you can tell it is building up to something).
- A bit linear and repetitive, and a few missed opportunities (bug bait... ).

If you like Half-Life 2, this is more of that in the best way possible.

8.5/10
The combine after housing their entire government and military production inside an active nuclear reactor.

[h1] Half-Life 2: Episode One [/h1]
1/5 first person shooter from 2006.

Episode One is the first episode in a game series that unveils what happened after Half-Life 2 and takes you on a new journey beyond the confines of City 17.
The first in a planned trilogy of shorter episodic games that continue the Half-Life 2 story. Episode One is a standalone expansion, meaning Half-Life 2 is not required to play. 
The trilogy only became two official standalone expansions, the third is not available on Steam. At my count above there is a short intro and two fan projects
contain.
If you're good at shooting your way through, you'll need about three and a half hours. I played the game all the way to the train station, about three hours, then it became too shooter-heavy for me.

This part starts seamlessly with HL2. I was busy climbing the eternally high tower to the top. Now that you are so close to heaven you have to go back down and to the train station to escape. Surprisingly, you encounter resistance. Someone probably doesn't want her to escape.

Great graphics at the time and still great today.
I personally like the game very much. It's tricky and on level normal you also have some difficult passages.
I currently accompanied HundelungeVR leif to the end. He is a shooter gamer and only occasionally had a problem progressing. Below is a link to YT where you can watch the game.
Suitable and recommended for trigger-happy gamers.

Here you get the full Half Life program. Various HL games are already online and there are more to come.
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2zGfp1auA43vXUG266M1Hg

[h1] Half-Life 2: Episode One [/h1]
1/5 Egoshooter von 2006.

Episode One ist die erste Episode einer Spieleserie, die enth√ºllt, was nach Half-Life 2 geschah, und Sie auf eine neue Reise √ºber die Grenzen von City 17 hinaus schickt.
Der erste Teil in einer geplanten Trilogie k√ºrzerer episodischer Spiele, die die Geschichte von Half-Life 2 fortsetzen. Episode One ist eine Standalone-Erweiterung, was bedeutet, dass Half-Life 2 zum Spielen nicht ben√∂tigt wird. Aus der Trilogie wurden nur zwei offizielle eigenst√§ndige Erweiterungen, die dritte gibt es nicht auf Steam. Bei meiner obrigen Z√§hlung sind noch ein kurzes Intro und zwei Fanprojekte enthalten.
Wenn ihr euch gut durchschie√üen tut braucht ihr etwa  dreieinhalb Stunden. Ich habe das Game damals bis zum Bahnhof gespielt also etwa drei Stunden, dann wurde es mir zu Shooterlastig.

Dieser Teil setzt fugenlos bei HL2 an. Ihr wart ja damit besch√§ftigt den ewig hohen Turm bis oben zu erklimmen. Jetzt da ihr dem Himmel so nah seit m√ºsst ihr wieder runter und auch noch zum Bahnhof um zu fl√ºchten. Erstaunlicher Weise st√∂√üt ihr auf Widerstand. Irgendwer will wohl nicht das ihr entkommt.

Seinerzeit eine grandiose Grafik und auch heute noch sehr gut.
Mir pers√∂nlich gef√§llt das Game sehr gut. Es ist knifflig und auf Stufe normal habt ihr auch einige schwierige Passagen.
Ich habe aktuell HundelungeVR life begleitet bis zum Schluss. Er ist Shootergamer und hatte nur gelegentlich mal ein Problem weiter zu kommen. Unten findet ihr ein Link zu YT, dort k√∂nnt ihr euch das Game anschauen.
Geeignet und empfohlen f√ºr schie√üw√ºtige Gamer.

A direct sequel to half life 2, you wake up after being knocked out, in the citadel. The first 30 minutes is really really boring, and the next chapter isn't great, and the puzzles are annoying. 1 annoying new "zombine" but thats the only new enemy. However the final two chapters are really great and almost make up for the lackluster start. 7/10

A continuation to a game that would have had a tidy story without one. I'm still glad we got more Half Life: 2, even if episode three was cancelled. I hope we get another game with new characters set in the future of the Half Life universe, and our heroes from these games become enigmatic

This is my least favourite Half Life episode to me. Its great for corridor combat and fighting combine soldiers with limited resources but doesn't have as much zany stuff as the others. Way too many puzzles and climbing through vents.
Good game worth 3 hours of gameplay
unironically the best installment of HL:2

Half-Life 2: Episode One continues the story of Half-Life 2 in an interesting way. The first of the episodic games that continue the story of Half-Life 2. It is a very short game & can be completed in under an hour. Game play wise, it's the exact same as Half-Life 2. Run, Think, Shoot. Very Basic, but it works great. Graphics & Audio are again, the same. However audio wise, new tracks are brought in & I think they sound great! New enemies are introduced but really nothing more than that. Overall, if you want to know what happens after Half-Life 2, this is the game for you. 8/10
Can't believe that Alyx said "time to half-life 2: Episode One"
so far i think its okay, but hl2 was more enjoyable imo.

Hello Possible  Purchaser, I'm here to convince you to purchase this game.  First of all, this game is a very short game that lasts maybe a 1 hour and 30 minutes minimum, even though it is short it is fun and makes you crave for more..  Good story telling, great action and puzzles, this game has a lot of fun packed inside a small package. Now onto the why you shouldnt buy it. This game has the following : blood, gore, violence and disturbing Lore ( lore meaning story in the background)  But all of that out of the way, this it Half life 2 Episode One.

Everyone knows about this perfect game and played it multiple times. However, I will just tell you one thing- this one like the others ( games of course) helped me a lot to escape from the real world nowadays when I'm not a kid and my least problem is to shave myself once a week. Maybe for one hour......or even more I feel myself happy again. Despite this, live your real lives, love the right people and be friendly and helpful to the right people. And of course- don't forget about ONE FREE MAN, who gave you perfect childhood.
